text: Antonio Sarmiento de Luna y Enríquez (1606 – 28 July 1661) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as Bishop of Sigüenza (1657–1661) and Bishop of Coria (1655–1657)." Bishop Antonio Sarmiento de Luna y Enríquez " Catholic- Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved August 27, 2016 ==Biography== Antonio Sarmiento de Luna y Enríquez was born in Madrid, Spain in 1606 and ordained a priest on 6 December 1654. On 14 May 1655, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Alexander VII as Bishop of Coria. On 8 April 1657, he was selected by the King of Spain and confirmed by Pope Alexander VII on 9 July 1657 as Bishop of Sigüenza. He served as Bishop of Coria until his death on 28 July 1661. == References == ==External links and additional sources== * (for Chronology of Bishops) * (for Chronology of Bishops) * (for Chronology of Bishops) * (for Chronology of Bishops) Category:17th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Alexander VII Category:1606 births Category:1661 deaths
title: Antonio Sarmiento de Luna y Enríquez
